text: [Music]
[Music]
hello
i'm brad support team member at the aws
office in cape town sometimes customers
ask me
how to locate resources using the bills
page
on the aws billing and cost management
console
i tell them you can find these resources
in a few easy steps
let me walk you through the process so
aws data centers
are located in different global regions
while the ec2 management console only
displays one aws region at a time
to locate the resource that you've
launched you need to choose specific
service you're looking for
on the bills page as you can see i've
already logged in
to my aws management console so now i'm
going to access the billing console
to do that i'm going to click on my name
and go to my billing dashboard
to view my current bills or to view the
services currently listed on my account
i'm going to go to polls on the left
hand side
and it's going to list all services
currently active on my account
to locate a resource that you've
launched you need to click on the
specific service
you can now see which resources you have
ec2 instances deployed in
in this case i'm going to go to my north
virginia region
and now we know where the instance is
located let's go find it
now that we know where the instance is
located we want to access this
through the ec2 management console
you do this by choosing services in the
top left of your screen
i'll now search for ec2
we're now looking at the ec2 management
console
notice that there are no running
instances this is because
we are not in the correct region the
region that i noticed on the billing
console stated
north virginia you'll see that we are
currently located
in the oregon region in order to change
this
we'll click on the region select north
virginia
now we can go to running instances
and there you go now you can view
and take required actions on your
instance
so you can do much the same to locate
any other resource
on your account we're going to start
from the billing dashboard again
which we'll find under your name
we're going to go to bills
you can select any other service much
the same as you did with ec2
you'll see i have these three buckets in
three regions
so we're going to go us east north
virginia
you'll see now you now have resources in
that region
now that we know we have resources in
that region we're going to go back to
services
the resource we're looking at was s3
so i'm going to type in s3
and there you go those are all the
buckets located in that region
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing
from all of us here at aws
[Music]
